Temple.Draughon\u2013Miller Central Texas Regio:
Draughon–Miller Central Texas Regional Airport (IATA: TPL, ICAO: KTPL, FAA LID: TPL) is a city owned, public use airport located five nautical miles (6 mi, 9 km) northwest of the central business district of Temple, a city in Bell County, Texas, United States. It is included in the National Plan of Integrated Airport Systems for 2011–2015, which categorized it as a general aviation facility.


== History ==
In July 1942, the United States Army Air Forces acquired pasture land and began construction of Temple Army Airfield.
